title: Dr. Cassie Jones NMD
description: Visit findatopdoc.com for all information on Dr. Cassie Jones NMD, Naturopath in La Mesa, CA, 91942. Profile, Reviews, Appointments, Insurances.
sitename: Dr. Cassie Jones NMD, Naturopath in La Mesa, CA, 91942
cleaned_text: Dr. Cassie Jones NMD Naturopath8911 La Mesa Blvd La Mesa CA, 91942 [Show map](#) About Dr. Cassie Jones Ruth is a naturopathic physician and primary care provider practicing in La Mesa, CA. Dr. Jones Ruth specializes in proactive prevention and treatment. Dr. Jones combines conventional medical care with natural solutions. Providing individual care, the most common ailments treated are hypothyroidism, hormone issues, menopause, perimenopause, pms, pcos, digestive issues, obesity, diabetes, hypertension, high cholesterol, and inflammation. Naturopathic Physicians place a strong emphasis on natural remedies that add to the broad spectrum of remedies available. I recommend speaking with you doctor to determine a plan that is best for you. Best of luck. I recommend asking the doctor who recommended them how they would like you to use them. There are many to choose from and all used differently for different conditions. Best of luck. [READ MORE](https://www.findatopdoc.com/Questions/how-should-I-use-essential-oils) [Do naturopath's use essential oils?](https://www.findatopdoc.com/Questions/do-naturopath-s-use-essential-oils) Naturopathic Doctors do have training in herbal medicine which does include essential oils. However, each doctor may have different modalities that they prefer to use so if you are specifically interested in essential oils I would ask them if they use them in their practice. Best of luck and I hope this answer was helpful. [READ MORE](https://www.findatopdoc.com/Questions/do-naturopath-s-use-essential-oils) [Do naturopathic physicians do healing work similar to chiropractors?](https://www.findatopdoc.com/Questions/do-naturopathic-physicians-do-healing-work-similar-to-chiropractors) Naturopathic Doctors are trained as primary care physicians with extra training in natural medicine. If you are looking for manual therapy (chiro adjustments, massage, etc) then you would need to find a Naturopathic Doctor who specializes in sports medicine. NDs are trained in manipulation (chiro adjustments) but not all NDs use these in practice, and not all states allow it. We are not licensed massage therapists. I hope this answer was helpful for you. You may want to seek out an ND that specializes in Sports Medicine. Best of Luck. [READ MORE](https://www.findatopdoc.com/Questions/is-exercise-incorporated-into-naturopathic-medicine) [What is the best natural remedy for varicose veins?](https://www.findatopdoc.com/Questions/what-is-best-natural-remedy-for-varicose-veins) I'm sorry to hear about your varicose veins. They are unlikely to be totally resolved on their own or with natural medicines. However if you're interested in something that may help them or help prevent them worsening then I'd look for an herbal blend formulated for vein health. Those often include herbs such as butchers broom, gotu kola, horse chestnut for example. Compression socks also helpful. You can work with a local ND to discuss what levels of these herbs are safe for you and your medical history. If caught early enough some herbs are powerful enough to treat. However, in my practice the most effective treatment often is an antibiotic. You may want to seek out an ND that can help prevent the UTI from returning and treat the underlying cause. Best of luck.
